name: py-obspy

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
ObsPy is an open-source project dedicated to provide a Python framework
for processing seismological data

dependencies.name: py-decorator
dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.

dependencies.name: py-lxml
dependencies.description:
lxml is the most feature-rich and easy-to-use library for processing XML
and HTML in the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-sqlalchemy
dependencies.description: The Python SQL Toolkit and Object Relational Mapper

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependent_to.name: neic-finitefault
dependent_to.description:
Wavelet and simulated Annealing SliP inversion (WASP). This code uses a
nonlinear simulated annealing inversion method to model slip amplitude,
rake, rupture time, and rise time on a discretized fault plane, finding
the solution that best fits the observations in the wavelet domain.
